shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols 3ra-225rb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-173r) II) Prayers (fols. 117v-118v) II-1) ʾƎsǝʿläkä o-ṗäraqliṭos mänfäs ʾab wä-wäld mänfäs ṣǝdq “I pray to you, o Paraclete Spirit of the Father and the Son, righteous Spirit…” (fols. 117v-118r) II-2) Säʾalǝnakä mäḥari säʾalǝnakä, säʾalǝnakä kähali säʾalǝnakä “We pray to You the Merciful we pray to you, we pray to You the Omnipotent we pray to you…” (fol. 118r-v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 173r-190v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 190v-200v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 201ra-218ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 218ra-225rb)
Additiones 1-7.

donors.donor: The name of the donor, <...> Dǝngǝl, has been partly preserved in Additio 4. The name has been also erased from the supplication formula on fol. 164v, written in the same hand. Gäbrä Maryam, Wälättä Zäkaryas and Wälättä Śǝllase are mentioned in the supplication formulas added, in a secondary hand, on fols. 50v, 60r, 69v, respectively. In the supplication formulas on e.g., fols. 25v, 82r, 98r, 109v the names have been erased.

owners.owner: The name of the original owner has been erased from the supplication formula on fol. 60r.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken, the back board is missing. The original sewing is for the most part missing; it is crudely repaired with recent threads. Many fols. are attached with one stitch repairs, e.g., fols. 1, 2, 10, 11, 80, 81, 90, 91, 158, 168 or through overcasting, e.g., fols. 177, 178, 179, 180, 181, 182, 183, 184, 185, 186, 187, 188, 195 (also visible at the spine). Fols. 1, 2, 227, 228, 229, 230, used as endleaves, originate from other Mss.

bindings.binding: The left wooden board is broken and half of it is missing, the right board is missing. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: The quire structure cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 20r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 202r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by broad and round forms of the letters. Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven”.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4 and I-5); titles of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles; numbers of Songs; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; doxology at the end of each Song; abbreviated refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A group of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; two lines (alternating with a black line) on the incipit page of Texts I-2, I-3, I-4; two lines of the incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4 and of the incipit of Text I-5.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እ᎓ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ምሕረት (Ps. 135, fols. 159r-160r) ስ᎓ for ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 185r-186r) Text I-4 ሰ᎓/ሰ፡አ፡ቅ) for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት (fols. 202va, 212rab, 212va, 213rb, 213va, 214va, 216ra, 217rab, 217vab) Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 201rb-202rb) እ᎓/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ(fols. 202vb-205rb) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 205va-208ra) ነ፡/ነዓ፡ for ነዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 209va-212ra) ለ፡/ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 212va-213va) ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 214vb-216ra) ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 216vb-217vb; 219vb-223ra) Text I-5 ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 219vb-224ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Ps. 1 is preceded by the following text: መሰተሣልቅኒ፡ ዘይሣለቅ፡ ላዕለ፡ ፈጣሪ… - Titles of some Pss. are preceded by the word ፍጻሜ (completion, end), perhaps referring to the ending of the previous ps., e.g., fols. 5r, 5v, 9v, 11v, 12r. - Traditional titles of the Pss. are sometimes missing, and only the words መዝሙር፡ ዘዳዊት (“Psalm of David”) are written, e.g., fols. 14v, 15r, 15v, 17r, 19r. - Ps. 118 is not numbered, the traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters is in most cases not completed, but simply ቤት፡ ብሂል፡, ጋሜል፡ ብሂል፡, etc. is written. The sections are numbered 1-19 (Alef-Qof) and 15-17 (Res-Taw). - A short prayer እግዚኦ፡ አእረፍ፡ ነፋስ፡ ለገብረከ... (“Lord, give rest to the soul of your servant...”) for the soul of the donor (whose name remains unknown) was written in a secondary hand, on fols. 69v, 82r, 109v, 135v, 156r, 164v. - Psalms numbered incorrectly: Pss. 71: ፸, 75: ፭, 79: ፸፰, 92: ፺፫, 93: ፺፬, 94: ፺፭, 95: ፺፮, 96: ፺፯, 97: ፺፰, 98: ፺፱, 99: ፻, 110: ፻፳, 119: ፻፳, 120: ፻፴፳ , 125: ፻፴፭, 126: ፻፴፮, 127: ፻፴፯, 128: ፻፴፯, 129: ፻፴፰, 130: ፻፴፱, 133: ፻፴፪, 134: ፻፴፫, 140: ፻፵፲, 150: ፻፵፲, 151: ፻፶. - Canticles numbered incorrectly: 11: ፲፪, 12: ፲፫, 13: ፲፬, 14: ፲፭, 15: ፲፬.

additional.cont: Fol. 1ra-vb: Prayer to St. Mary.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a trained hand, in red and black. The text on fol. 1r is barely legible.

additional.cont: Fol. 2ra: Prayer against the sickness of the eye.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a well trained hand. The fol. is badly damaged; due to this the prayer is only partly legible.
The fol. is badly damaged, the text is not legible.
The note is written in a later hand. The name of the donor and the name of the church have been erased.

additional.cont: Fol. 225va-226vb: Protective prayer (?), incomplete.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a well trained hand. The name of the original supplicant has been erased (only the second component remained) and replace by the name of Zä-Mikaʾel.

additional.cont: Fol. 227ra-230vb: Təmḫərtä ḫəbuˀat “Teaching of Mysteries”, incomplete.
additional.det: The incipit of the text is on fol. 229va. It is written in a well-trained hand in red and black. The fols. are attached only through one stitch repairs, apparently also in the wrong order.
The note is hardly legible, written in the bottom margin.

extras.extra: - The midpoint of the Psalter (Ps. 77:14) is marked with a chain of red and black dots on fol. 91r; the words መንፈቀ፡ ዳዊት “middle of Dawit” are written in a secondary hand in the upper margin. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten or fifty separated by chains of red and black dots: Pss. 10/11, 50/51, 100/101. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omitted passages belong: fols. 99v l.11; 173r l.7. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: e.g., fols 35v, 100v, 110v, 152r, 153v, 163v. - Part of the line is taken up, e.g., fols. 110v, 138v, 167v. - Ethiopic numeral ፲ is written beside a verse of a Ps. on fols. 29r-56r. - Omitted letters, words or passages are written interlinearly, in the main hand and in secondary hands: e.g., fols. 11v, 38r, 46v, 51r, 56v, 66r, 69r, 78r, 108r, 110v, 113v, 128r, 132r, 140r, 143r, 173r, 177v, 181r, 184v, 186v, 188r, 192v, 194r, 195r, 200r, 218va. - Corrections written over erasure on many fols. e.g., 47v, 78r, 57v, 67v, 74v, 75r, 106v. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin lines above and below words or passages: e.g., fols.29r, 83v, 107r. - Recent pagination in Ethiopic numerals. - Crude doodles in pen or pencil: fols. 36r, 82v, 98r, 164v, 200v. - Minor notes, scribbles: fols. 3r, 61r, 66r, 191, 206v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire marks are visible on some fols., but without a logical order, e.g., fols. 14r: ፪, 25r: ፫, 35r: ፬, 128r: ፪, 138: ፫.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written, in a recent poor hand, in the upper margin: ዘሰሉሥ: fol. 36r ዘረቡዕ: fol. 69v ዘነግህ: fol. 70v ዘሐሙስ: fol. 98r ዘዓርብ: fol. 135v ዘቀዳም: fol. 156r ዘሰርክ፡ fols. 163v ዘሰንበት, ዘሰኑይ: fol. 173r ዘረቡዕ: fol. 179r ዘቀዳም: fol 182v ዘወትር: fol. 184v, 185r ዘሐሙስ: fol. 186r ዘዓርብ: fol. 188r. - A red thread inserted in the upper corner of many fols. e.g., 67, 68, 69, 118, 135, 152, 156, 173, 190.

frames.frame: - Fol. 173r: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating between Text I-1 and Text I-2. - Fol. 190v: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating Texts I-2 and Text I-3. - Fol. 200v: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating Texts I-3 and Text I-4, geometric motifs. - Fols. 202va, 205va, 214va, 216ra: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating the daily readings in Texts I-4. - Fol. 218ra: Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band, separating Texts I-4 and Text I-5.
